page.title: 06Trout Farm 1:The Deverills
page.content: The{Trout Farm}at{Longbridge Deverill has been open for six years. They were attracted to the site because they can obtain fresh cool water from the bore hole at the{Cress Farm}at{Hill {Deverill}and water from the{River {Wylye.}They are also relatively close to the London market. The Trout Farm consists of two large sheds housing the tanks of trout in their various stages, and a shop where the trout are also prepared for sale. They also smoke the trout and have their own cress beds. About twenty customers a day call at the shop for fresh trout and cress but the biggest customers are restaurants. A van takes retail orders mainly smoked trout to London three times a week and the farm also supplies local restaurants. The first large order of smoked trout has just been despatched to America.
